content: Yes, Raphael's influence on Renaissance architecture was massive and his work on Saint Peter's Basilica is considered a masterpiece even today. The church's dome, for example, has come to represent the perfect fusion of design, engineering, and mathematics in architecture. It is still widely regarded as one of the most impressive architectural feats in history. Moreover, Raphael's use of classical elements and emphasis on symmetry and proportion in his design set the standard for Renaissance architecture and paved the way for future developments in the field.
